EditInstructions.en-us: This is (optional) metadata for the content-type. Imagine it as added information, which if available, will be used in dialogs to enhance the user experience.

ListInstructions.en-us: These are Metadata for existing Content-Types. Please edit with caution. Make sure you know what you're doing.

DeleteWarning.en-us: This usually contains descriptions for content-types, and shouldn't be deleted.

Note.en-us: Warning: This data contains name/description of this Content-Type. You usually don't want to delete it.

Notes.*: This is the nice name shown in the end user dialogs. You should keep it short and simple. Read the recommendations in help.
A nice description of what this content-type is for. It will be shown as tool-tip or help-text in normal user dialogs, so keep it simple and non-techie.

Name.*: More Settings like Icon, Notes etc.

Notes.*: Use this for internal, technical notes. It won't be shown to the content editors.

Notes.en-us: Give this content-type an icon to use in tile-style buttons - see docs. We recommend using the [App:Path] placeholder.

Notes.*: This is an optional link to further information, tutorials, help, etc. It will be shown to the end user if such a link exists.
Instructions shown to the user in the edit-form for additional help/assistance.
This text will be shown above the normal list of items to provide context or help. That will be implemented in 2sxc 10, ATM it doesn't happen yet.

Notes.en-us: Configure special settings for formulas editing this content type. See docs.

Name.en-us: System Settings to allow Formulas to use (beta)

Notes.en-us: Specify what settings will be broadcast to use in the formula.

Name.*: Super WIP / Beta Properties - don't touch

Title.*: Setting Name: Indicate it has content

Formula.*: v1(data) { return data.default + ( data.Notes || data.Icon || data.Link ? ' ✅' : '') ; }

EditInstructions.*:
Configure the permissions of views or content-types (see wiki). 

If you want to use new user-identity or groups in the permissions, you'll need to enable the user-feature or group-feature. For the public-users-can-only-create draft data, make sure you also enable that feature.

Notes.*: A title just to help you know what this rule is for.

DropdownValues.en-us:
:Choose a type to get better guidance in selecting permissions
contenttype:Content-Type Permissions
language:Language Permissions
query:Query Permissions
app:App Permissions
view:View Permissions

Notes.en-us: To set language permissions, specify a user-group name in the identity, and "Edit" in the Grant.

Notes.*: You can type in a user GUID here, or group number(s) like "5, 12". Make sure you enable the feature.

Notes.en-us:
Why this security rule should apply.
Learn more on 2sxc.org/help?tag=permissions

DropdownValues.en-us:
Please Select:
Anonymous (any user):SecurityAccessLevel.Anonymous
View:SecurityAccessLevel.View
Edit:SecurityAccessLevel.Edit
Admin:SecurityAccessLevel.Admin
Host:SecurityAccessLevel.Host
Author / Creator of a Content-Item:Owner

Notes.en-us:
What we will grant in this rule. 
Learn more on 2sxc.org/help?tag=permissions

DropdownValues.en-us:
None (no permissions defined):-
Read:r
Create (no read or edit):c
Update (read and modify existing):ru
Delete:d
Edit (Create, Read, Update, Delete):crud
All Content (CRUD + Approve):cruda
All Content + Permissions:crudap
Design/Develop (modify internal structure):crudav
Design and Permissions:crudavp
Full Control (usually host only):crudavpz
Read schema (applies to content-types):$
Read drafts (applies to content-types):ř
Create draft (applies to content-types):č
Update drafts (applies to content-types):ǔ
Edit draft CRUD (applies to centent-types):řčǔď

Notes.*: The name of the app as shown in the app-picker. Can be translated to other languages as needed.
A short description of this app - more for your own use.
A version - needed for various checks - in the format 01.03.08
The folder of this app within the 2sxc-folder - only change this if you know what you're doing.

Notes.en-us: Show / hide this in the app selector. Advanced apps are usually set to hidden once the developer adds them to the necessary pages.

TitleTrue.en-us: Hidden - will not appear in add-app list

Notes.*: Allow token templates. As of now, this is only informative. In the future, it may be used to enforce certain rules.
Allow token templates. As of now, this is only informative. In the future, it may be used to enforce certain rules.

If your views can handle being reloaded inside the page without requiring a page-refresh, then activate this. This setting applies to all views in this app, so only use it if your app is fully AJAX ready. Read more about this in 2sxc.org/help?tag=ajax
These are requirements for installing on another platform. The developer sets these values as he/she believes is correct.

Notes.en-us: The version of 2sxc required for this app to work. Use it when you rely on 2sxc features which don't exist is other versions. read more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=app
The version of DNN required for this app to work. Use it when you rely on DNN features which don't exist is other versions. read more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=app
Minimum version of Oqtane supported. Leave empty if it doesn't support Oqtane.

Notes.*: A GUID of the original app. This is used for cases where you clone an app with another id, and we want to remember the original ID - for example to point to help content.

Notes.en-us: Special value to track down issues with app data creation https://github.com/2sic/2sxc/issues/3203
